result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Gerald M Parks in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Gerald M Parks.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty O'Connell moves to withdraw as counsel; argument by Atty O'Connell. Colloquy w/ defn. Defn advised of rights and right to an atty. CT makes findings and grants motion. CT allows Atty O'Connell to w/d as counsel and orders SPD to appointment successor counsel. CT directs Atty O'Connell to cooperate with the transfer of the file. SPD notified f/w.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Gerald M Parks in court.  Attorney Tim Helmberger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Gerald M Parks. CT to set for PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gerald M Parks
Current: 115 W Doty St, c/o DCJ, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2022)
Prior: 615 E Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53703

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
